data.chText: 好运；幸运；侥幸
data.enText: good things that happen to you by chance, not because of your own efforts or abilities

data.chText: 如果一切顺利的话，我们可在天黑前回到家。
data.enText: With (any) luck , we'll be home before dark.

data.chText: 如果我们运气好，就能够准时完成。
data.enText: With a bit of luck , we'll finish on time.

data.chText: 我找工作一直不走运。
data.enText: So far I have had no luck with finding a job.

data.chText: 听他说行，我几乎不敢相信自己会这么走运。
data.enText: I could hardly believe my luck when he said yes.

data.chText: 真巧我们找到了你。
data.enText: It was a stroke of luck that we found you.

data.chText: 万幸的是，没有人在爆炸中受伤。
data.enText: By sheer luck nobody was hurt in the explosion.

data.chText: 我们祝愿她在新的事业中一帆风顺。
data.enText: We wish her luck in her new career.

data.chText: 你运气不错——还剩一张票。
data.enText: You're in luck (= lucky) ─there's one ticket left.

data.chText: 真不巧，她不在。
data.enText: You're out of luck . She's not here.

data.chText: 运气真好！
data.enText: What a piece of luck!

data.chText: 机遇；命运；运气
data.enText: chance; the force that causes good or bad things to happen to people

data.chText: 运气好 / 坏
data.enText: to have good/bad luck
any luck?

data.chText: （询问是否成功）运气怎么样
data.enText: used to ask sb if they have been successful with sth

data.chText: “运气怎么样？”“不怎么样，他们都没空帮忙。”
data.enText: ‘Any luck?’ ‘No, they're all too busy to help.’
as luck would have it

data.chText: 碰巧；偶然；幸而；不巧
data.enText: in the way that chance decides what will happen

data.chText: 不巧火车晚点了。
data.enText: As luck would have it, the train was late.
bad, hard, etc. luck (on sb)

data.chText: （表示同情）运气不佳，不幸
data.enText: used to express sympathy for sb

data.chText: 海伦，你的表演非常好，只是运气欠佳。
data.enText: Bad luck, Helen, you played very well.

data.chText: 他未被选中真是不幸。
data.enText: It's hard luck on him that he wasn't chosen.
be down on your luck

data.chText: 因一时不走运而没有钱；穷困潦倒
data.enText: to have no money because of a period of bad luck
the best of luck (with sth)
good luck (with sth)

data.chText: 祝成功；祝好运
data.enText: used to wish sb success with sth

data.chText: 祝你考试成功！
data.enText: The best of luck with your exams.

data.chText: 祝你交好运！我希望这事进展顺利。
data.enText: Good luck! I hope it goes well.
better luck next time

data.chText: （鼓励未成功的人）祝下次好运
data.enText: used to encourage sb who has not been successful at sth
for luck

data.chText: 图个吉利；为了带来好运
data.enText: because you believe it will bring you good luck, or because this is a traditional belief

data.chText: 挑件蓝色的东西吧，求个吉利。
data.enText: Take something blue. It's for luck.

data.chText: 无缘无故
data.enText: for no particular reason

data.chText: 我无故又打了他一下。
data.enText: I hit him once more for luck.
good luck to sb

data.chText: （与己无关而不介意某人的所为）祝某人成功，祝某人走运
data.enText: used to say that you do not mind what sb does as it does not affect you, but you hope they will be successful

data.chText: 这件事我自己是不想做的，但如果她想试一试，祝愿她成功。
data.enText: It's not something I would care to try myself but if she wants to, good luck to her.
just my/sb's luck

data.chText: （对自己的遭遇并不惊讶）常不走运，就这运气
data.enText: used to show you are not surprised sth bad has happened to you, because you are not often lucky

data.chText: 我总是这样倒霉，他们离去后我才赶到。
data.enText: Just my luck to arrive after they had left.
your/sb's luck is in

data.chText: 交好运；走运
data.enText: used to say that sb has been lucky or successful
the luck of the draw

data.chText: 运气的结果
data.enText: the fact that chance decides sth, in a way that you cannot control
no such luck

data.chText: （所希望的事情没有发生而失望）没那么走运
data.enText: used to show disappointment that sth you were hoping for did not happen
pot luck

data.chText: 碰运气；撞大运；随遇而安
data.enText: when you take pot luck , you choose sth or go somewhere without knowing very much about it, but hope that it will be good, pleasant, etc.

data.chText: 能不能得到好的指点那就全靠运气了。
data.enText: It's pot luck whether you get good advice or not.

data.chText: 欢迎你留下来吃晚饭，不过你得有什么就吃什么了。
data.enText: You're welcome to stay to supper, but you'll have to take pot luck (= eat whatever is available) .
tough luck

data.chText: （表示同情）倒霉，不走运
data.enText: used to show sympathy for sth unfortunate that has happened to sb

data.chText: “我差一分没及格。”“运气真不好。”
data.enText: ‘I failed by one point.’ ‘That's tough luck.’

data.chText: （表面上同情）多么倒霉
data.enText: used to show that you do not feel sorry for sb who has a problem

data.chText: “如果你把车开走，我就出不去了。”“多倒霉啊！”
data.enText: ‘If you take the car, I won't be able to go out.’ ‘Tough luck!’
luck out

data.chText: 走运；交好运
data.enText: to be lucky

data.chText: 我想，我遇到她真是交了好运。
data.enText: I guess I really lucked out when I met her.

data.text: luck ♦ chance ♦ coincidence ♦ accident ♦ fortune ♦ fate ♦ destiny ♦ providence

data.chText: 以上各词均指机遇、命运、运气。
data.enText: These are all words for things that happen or the force that causes them to happen.
luck

data.chText: 指机遇、命运、运气：
data.enText: the force that causes good or bad things to happen to people

data.chText: 这戒指总是给我带来好运。
data.enText: This ring has always brought me good luck.
chance

data.chText: 指偶然、碰巧、意外：
data.enText: the way that some things happen without any cause that you can see or understand

data.chText: 这结果可能纯属意外。
data.enText: The results could simply be due to chance.
coincidence

data.chText: 指出人意料的巧合、巧事：
data.enText: the fact of two things happening at the same time by chance, in a surprising way

data.chText: 他们因一连串奇妙的巧合而相遇。
data.enText: They met through a series of strange coincidences.
accident

data.chText: 指意外、偶然的事：
data.enText: something that happens unexpectedly and is not planned in advance

data.chText: 他们早到仅仅是偶然而已。
data.enText: Their early arrival was just an accident.
fortune

data.chText: 尤指影响人生的机会、运气：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) luck or chance, especially in the way it affects people's lives

data.chText: 只有那次我们运气好，那一天阳光普照。
data.enText: For once, fortune was on our side: the sun shone that day.
fate

data.chText: 指命运、天数、定数、天意：
data.enText: the power that is believed to control everything that happens and that cannot be stopped or changed

data.chText: 命中注定她永远到不了美国。
data.enText: Fate decreed that she would never reach America.
destiny

data.chText: 指主宰事物的力量、命运之神：
data.enText: the power that is believed to control events

data.chText: 我总认为有某种力量在指引着我们——叫它上帝也罢，天意也罢，还是命运也罢。
data.enText: I believe there's some force guiding us─call it God, destiny or fate.
providence

data.chText: 指上帝、苍天、天佑：
data.enText: ( formal ) God, or a force that some people believe controls our lives and the things that happen to us, usually in a way that protects us

data.chText: 他相信上苍。
data.enText: He trusted in divine providence.

data.chText: 用fate、destiny还是providence？
一般认为providence是善意的，即使降临苦难也是上帝安排的一部分；fate有时是善意的，但那只是意外的恩赐；同样经常地，fate也是残酷的，使人感到无能为力；destiny更可能给人力量的感觉，具有强烈使命感的人通常认为自己是天生伟大或成就伟大事业的人。
data.enText: Providence is usually seen as being kind: even when it sends suffering, this is accepted as being part of God's plan. Fate can be kind, but this is an unexpected gift; just as often, fate is cruel and makes people feel helpless. Destiny is more likely to give people a sense of power: people who have a strong sense of destiny usually believe that they are meant to be great or do great things.
fate, destiny or providence?
by/through …luck/chance/coincidence/accident
It was… luck/chance/coincidence/accident/fortune/fate/providence that…
It's no coincidence/accident that…
pure/sheer/mere luck/chance/coincidence/accident
good/bad/ill luck/fortune
to have the … luck/fortune to do sth
to tempt fate/providence (= to do sth too confidently in a way that might mean that your good luck will come to an end)
sb's luck/fortune changes/turns
a stroke of luck/fortune/fate
a twist of fortune/fate

ex.zh: 运气如何/走霉运/运气更好/好运/不走运

data.enText: any luck?

data.chText: （询问是否成功）运气怎么样
data.enText: used to ask sb if they have been successful with sth

data.chText: “运气怎么样？”“不怎么样，他们都没空帮忙。”
data.enText: ‘Any luck?’ ‘No, they're all too busy to help.’

data.enText: to have no money because of a period of bad luck

good luck (with sth)

data.enText: used to wish sb success with sth

data.enText: The best of luck with your exams.

data.enText: Good luck! I hope it goes well.

data.enText: used to encourage sb who has not been successful at sth

data.enText: because you believe it will bring you good luck, or because this is a traditional belief

data.chText: 挑件蓝色的东西吧，求个吉利。
data.enText: Take something blue. It's for luck.

data.enText: for no particular reason

data.chText: 我无故又打了他一下。
data.enText: I hit him once more for luck.

data.chText: （与己无关而不介意某人的所为）祝某人成功，祝某人走运
data.enText: used to say that you do not mind what sb does as it does not affect you, but you hope they will be successful

data.chText: 这件事我自己是不想做的，但如果她想试一试，祝愿她成功。
data.enText: It's not something I would care to try myself but if she wants to, good luck to her.
just my/sb's luck

data.chText: （对自己的遭遇并不惊讶）常不走运，就这运气
data.enText: used to show you are not surprised sth bad has happened to you, because you are not often lucky

data.chText: 我总是这样倒霉，他们离去后我才赶到。
data.enText: Just my luck to arrive after they had left.

data.enText: used to say that sb has been lucky or successful
the luck of the draw

data.chText: 运气的结果
data.enText: the fact that chance decides sth, in a way that you cannot control
no such luck

data.chText: （所希望的事情没有发生而失望）没那么走运
data.enText: used to show disappointment that sth you were hoping for did not happen
pot luck

data.chText: 碰运气；撞大运；随遇而安
data.enText: when you take pot luck , you choose sth or go somewhere without knowing very much about it, but hope that it will be good, pleasant, etc.

data.chText: 能不能得到好的指点那就全靠运气了。
data.enText: It's pot luck whether you get good advice or not.

data.chText: 欢迎你留下来吃晚饭，不过你得有什么就吃什么了。
data.enText: You're welcome to stay to supper, but you'll have to take pot luck (= eat whatever is available) .
push your luck
push it/things

data.chText: （由于过去的成功过关）再冒一次险，继续碰运气
data.enText: to take a risk because you have successfully avoided problems in the past

data.chText: 上次没被逮住，但你不要再心存侥幸了！
data.enText: You didn't get caught last time, but don't push your luck!
tough luck

data.chText: （表示同情）倒霉，不走运
data.enText: used to show sympathy for sth unfortunate that has happened to sb

data.chText: “我差一分没及格。”“运气真不好。”
data.enText: ‘I failed by one point.’ ‘That's tough luck.’

data.chText: （表面上同情）多么倒霉
data.enText: used to show that you do not feel sorry for sb who has a problem

data.chText: “如果你把车开走，我就出不去了。”“多倒霉啊！”
data.enText: ‘If you take the car, I won't be able to go out.’ ‘Tough luck!’
try your luck (at sth)

data.chText: 碰运气
data.enText: to do sth that involves risk or luck, hoping to succeed

data.chText: 我的祖父母移民到加拿大去碰碰运气。
data.enText: My grandparents emigrated to Canada to try their luck there.
worse luck!

data.chText: （表示失望）倒霉，不幸，可惜
data.enText: used to show that you are disappointed about sth

data.chText: 我参加不了这次聚会了，真倒霉！
data.enText: I shall have to miss the party, worse luck!
luck out

data.chText: 走运；交好运
data.enText: to be lucky

data.chText: 我想，我遇到她真是交了好运。
data.enText: I guess I really lucked out when I met her.

tr: an unknown and unpredictable phenomenon that causes an event to result one way rather than another
example: we ran into each other by pure chance

tr: an unknown and unpredictable phenomenon that leads to a favorable outcome
example: it was my good luck to be there
they say luck is a lady
it was as if fortune guided his hand

tr: your overall circumstances or condition in life (including everything that happens to you)

value.def: Luck or good luck is success or good things that happen to you, that do not come from your own abilities or efforts.

example.ex: I knew I needed a bit of luck to win...
example.tran: 我知道自己要赢需要点运气。

example.ex: The Sri Lankans have been having no luck with the weather...
example.tran: 斯里兰卡人在天气方面运气一直很差。

example.ex: The goal, when it came, owed more to good luck than good planning.
example.tran: 最后终于进球了，但这更多的是靠侥幸，而不是良好的战术配合。

value.def: Bad luck is lack of success or bad things that happen to you, that have not been caused by yourself or other people.

example.ex: I had a lot of bad luck during the first half of this season...
example.tran: 上半赛季我一直走背运。

example.ex: Randall's illness was only bad luck.
example.tran: 兰德尔生病纯粹是时运不济。

value.def: If you ask someone the question 'Any luck?' or 'No luck?', you want to know if they have been successful in something they were trying to do.
You can say 'Bad luck', or 'Hard luck', to someone when you want to express sympathy to them.
If you say that something brings bad luck or brings someone good luck, you believe that it has an influence on whether good or bad things happen to them.

example.ex: Jean was extremely superstitious and believed the colour green brought bad luck.
example.tran: 琼十分迷信，她认为绿色不吉利。

value.tran: 带来霉运/带来好运；不吉利/ 吉利

value.def: If you describe someone as down on their luck, you mean that they have had bad experiences, often because they do not have enough money.
value.tran: （常指因缺钱而）遭遇厄运，时运不济

value.def: If you say that something is the luck of the draw, you mean that it is the result of chance and you cannot do anything about it.

example.ex: The luck of the draw meant the young lad had to face one of America's best players.
example.tran: 完全是运气使然，这位小伙子必须面对一位美国一流选手。

value.tran: 碰巧的运气；运气的结果

value.def: If you say 'Good luck' or 'Best of luck' to someone, you are telling them that you hope they will be successful in something they are trying to do.

example.ex: He kissed her on the cheek. 'Best of luck!'
example.tran: 他吻了吻她的脸颊。“祝你好运！”

value.def: You can say someone is in luck when they are in a situation where they can have what they want or need.

example.ex: You're in luck. The doctor's still in.

value.def: If you say it is just your luck that something unpleasant has happened to you, you mean that this is quite normal because unpleasant things are always happening to you.

example.ex: It would be just his luck to miss the last boat.
example.tran: 他就这运气，误了最后一班船也毫不出奇。

value.def: If you say that someone is out of luck, you mean that they cannot have something which they can normally have.

example.ex: 'What do you want, Roy? If it's  money, you're out of luck.'
example.tran: “你想要什么，罗伊？要钱的话，那你别指望了。”

value.tran: 运气不好；不走运；不凑巧

value.def: You can say 'No such luck' when you want to express your disappointment over something.

example.ex: He must have been hoping for a relaxed time. No such luck.
example.tran: 他一定是一直想放松一段时间，可就是没这个命。

value.def: If you say that someone is pushing their luck, you think they are taking a bigger risk than is sensible, and may get into trouble.

example.ex: I didn't dare push my luck too far and did not ask them to sign statements.
example.tran: 我不敢太过贪心不足，没有要他们签署声明。

value.tran: 得寸进尺；冒不明智的风险

value.def: If you say that luck was on someone's side, you mean that they succeeded in something by chance as well as by their own efforts or ability.

example.ex: Rick seems to have had luck on his side during his 12-year acting career.
example.tran: 在12年的演艺生涯中，里克好像总有福星高照。

value.tran: 受幸运之神眷顾；福星高照

value.def: If someone tries their luck at something, they try to succeed at it, often when it is very difficult or there is little chance of success.

example.ex: She was going to try her luck at the Las Vegas casinos.
example.tran: 她打算去拉斯韦加斯的赌场碰碰运气。

value.def: You can add with luck or with any luck to a statement to indicate that you hope that a particular thing will happen.

example.ex: We'll have a long talk and a good cry and then with any luck  we'll both feel better.
example.tran: 我们会一席长谈，大哭一场，但愿这样我们两个都会好过一点。

value.tran: 希望；但愿；运气好的话；一切顺利的话

trans: 三生有幸；意外的好运；一次幸运；一次好运
(非自身过错造成的)坏运气，噩运；(自身过错造成的)不幸，不走运
